video.title: Figma Course - Web Design Tutorial for Beginners
video.description:
Learn how to use Figma to design websites.

💻 Figma link: https://www.figma.com/community/file/1006624870389379433

✏️ Course developed by Joy Shaheb. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHG7IJuST_BXJkne-0u0Xtw

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Intro
⌨️ (0:04:32) Figma Setup
⌨️ (0:08:05) Left Panel
⌨️ (0:14:34) Top + right Panel
⌨️ (0:40:57) Text Tool
⌨️ (0:59:10) prototype test
⌨️ (1:03:54) Auto Layout
⌨️ (1:17:06) Layout Grid
⌨️ (1:22:27) Constraints
⌨️ (1:29:07) Components
⌨️ (1:36:54) Desktop Design
⌨️ (2:32:54) Mobile Design

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Wong Voon jinq
👾 hexploitation
👾 Katia Moran
👾 BlckPhantom
👾 Nick Raker
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 AppWrite

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

replies.text: @Aastha Gupta no bro

replies.author: Aastha Gupta
replies.text: @V.S.S.K Does this tool work the same way as canva?

replies.author: V.S.S.K
replies.text: in some large company there exists a  separate UI/UX team/individual / some company might  call that post as  (Senior Designer /Designer)  who will create these Figmas , which are then passed on to Front End Engineers who code them in respective FrontEnd tech stack by taking CSS references / other graphics from these Figmas. The primary advantage which I see is its online and easy for collaboration , it doesn't lag as the team size or project size increases , also it eliminates the dependency on other designing application , this single web app has the ability to drive your design till production.
